Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to
a youth's background or appearance or mental state.
Yelling, threats, ridicule, or humiliation are strictly
prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Supervisor 1 stated inappropriate things to Youth A after Youth A
awoke from a medical episode.
Investigation The Complainant for the allegations provided was anonymous,
so no further information was able to be provided.
Attempts to interview Youth A during face-to-face visits at the
facility were made on 08/05/2024 and 09/19/2024. Youth A
refused to speak for this investigation.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone on 10/15/2024. He
recalled the incident in question involving Youth A. Supervisor 1
stated Youth A had been taken to the hospital prior to his
involvement. Supervisor 1 recalled meeting other staff involved at
the door when Youth A arrived back from the hospital. Supervisor
1 recalled hearing Youth A had taken off his own clothes on the
ride back to the facility. Supervisor 1 recalled Staff 3 and himself
receiving Youth A as his transport pulled into the facility sally port.
Youth A was refusing to get out of the van at that point in time.
Supervisor 1 got a blanket for Youth A to wear because he
believed Youth A was not going to put his clothes back on at that
point in time. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A eventually getting out
of the van and walking back to his pod with a blanket covering him
when he began to escalate again, at that point sitting on the
ground in a hallway. Supervisor 1 noted that there were no other
youth around at that point in time. Supervisor 1 recalled
Supervisor 2 and Staff 2 joining him to attempt to de-escalate
2

Youth A. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A eventually got up on his
own to return to his pod. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A making
several comments over that course of time referencing how he
was naked. Supervisor 1 denied making any statements himself
about Youth A being naked or Youth A’s body. He also did not
hear any other staff say anything similar or inappropriate to Youth
A. Supervisor 1 remarked that he had experience with Youth A’s
escalated behaviors and in his experience the best thing to do
was to stay nearby but not talk back to Youth A and engage in any
negative comments in order to attempt to “get through” what he
was going through to get to more compliant behavior.
Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone on 10/17/2024. She
recalled the incident in question. Staff 2 stated she was assisting
other staff in getting Youth A back to his pod when he was naked
and refusing to move through the hallway. Staff 2 did not see any
other staff attempt to physically manage Youth A. Staff 2 did not
report hearing Supervisor 1 comment on Youth A being naked,
Youth A’s body, or anything else inappropriate.
Attempts were made to speak with Staff 3 on 10/17/2024 and
11/20/2024 and no contact was made.
Attempts were made to speak with Supervisor 2 on 10/17/2024
and 12/06/2024 and no contact was made.
Documents Reviewed:
• Medical documentation from the facility dated 07/31/2024
was provided and reviewed. It was stated that nursing staff
performed a follow up assessment with Youth A after he
had to be taken to the hospital on 07/25/2024 due to a
possible seizure. Accompanying documentation from
Children’s Hospital of Michigan dated 07/25/2024 stated
that Youth A had been seen and was diagnosed with a
psychogenic non-epileptic seizure. Additional facility
medical progress notes dated 07/25/2024 detailed the
symptoms shown by Youth A that prompted the trip to the
hospital at 4:36 pm. It was documented that Youth A
returned from the hospital at 8:26 pm after discharge from
the hospital. There was nothing in this documentation that
addressed the allegations regarding comments made to
Youth A upon return from the hospital.
• An Unusual Incident Report Summary from the facility
dated 07/25/2024 was provided and reviewed. This
described Youth A’s trip back from the hospital on that
date. It noted that Youth A’s behavior was escalated at the
3

time of leaving the hospital in that he attempted to escape.
Staff were able to get him transported back to the facility.
During that transportation Youth A removed his clothing
and continued to display escalated behaviors. It was noted
that Youth A arrived back at the facility and went back to
his pod and bedroom.
• Facility behavior management policies & procedures were
provided and reviewed. This policy stated that “the use of
verbal and non-physical crisis intervention communication
intervention techniques will de-escalate the youth and
prevent the need for physical intervention. These
communication techniques include listening, supportive
communication, problem solving counseling, and conflict
resolution counseling.” This policy did not outline
prohibited acts of staff of verbal communication with youth.
• Facility verbal de-escalation training materials were
provided and reviewed. This training material outlined how
staff are trained on the belief that “all people have the right
to be treated with dignity and respect.”
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation reviewed. There was no evidence
found that Supervisor 1 used disparaging or inappropriate
language towards Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Supervisor 1 punched Youth B during an altercation.
4

Investigation Youth B was interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face
visit at the facility on 09/19/2024. Youth B recalled the incident in
question. Youth B stated he was never punched by staff. During
the escalated incident he fell to the floor as he was being
restrained, but he stated that this was not because of staff, and he
was on his back. Youth B did not recall any other details of the
incident.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone on 10/15/2024. He
recalled the incident in question involving Youth B. Supervisor 1
believed Youth B had received some difficult news after a court
hearing and began to escalate within the pod. Supervisor 1
recalled coming into the pod after Youth B had assaulted some
peers, who had then been cleared out of the pod. Supervisor 1
recalled Youth B not being restrained at this time, allowing him to
move about the pod to see if he could be de-escalated.
Supervisor 1 recalled Youth B not being able to be de-escalated
and then having to be restrained. Supervisor 1 described this as
an escort and within a short amount of time Youth B was moved to
his room. Supervisor 1 denied punching Youth B in any form and
did not recall seeing any injuries to Youth B’s face as a result of
the interaction.
Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone on 10/17/2024. She
recalled Youth B being upset after a court hearing and escalating
within the pod. Staff 2 stated that she could not recall many
details of the rest of the incident, but denied seeing Supervisor 1
or any other staff hit Youth B.
Video reviewed:
• Video footage of the incident was reviewed with
Administrator 2 and Licensee Designee during an
unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility on
08/05/2024. The video footage showed Youth B in an
escalated state within the pod and several staff members
that could not be identified attempting to interact with him.
Supervisor 1 restrained Youth A from behind and moved
him to his room. As he was doing so Youth A fought back
and this restraint attempt contained aggressive movements
from both Youth A and Supervisor 1. The restraint attempt
lasted only seconds before Youth A entered his room. At
no point did it appear that Supervisor 1 or any other staff hit
Youth A in any manner.
5

Documentation Reviewed:
• Facility policy on youth discipline and behavior
management was provided and reviewed. This
documentation outlined prohibited conduct from staff to
youth, including any type of physical discipline.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation reviewed. There was no evidence
found that Youth B was hit by Supervisor 1 during the identified
incident.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty
to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency's program statement
and to provide for the continual needs, protection, and
supervision of residents
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Despite concerns over the safety of the two youth, the facility
refuses to separate Youth A and Youth C.
Investigation The Complainant for the allegations provided was anonymous,
so no further information was able to be provided.
Administrator 2 was interviewed during an unannounced, face-
to-face visit to the facility on 08/05/2024. He remarked on the
facility’s ability to keep Youth A and Youth C in separate units but
could not recall when that was able to occur.
Attempts to interview Youth A during face-to-face visits at the
facility were made on 08/05/2024 and 09/19/2024. Youth A
refused to speak for this investigation.
Youth C was interviewed on 09/25/2024 over the phone. He
stated that he was not familiar with Youth A and did not believe he
had been placed in the same pod as Youth A during his time at
the facility.
6

Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone on 10/15/2024. He
did not believe that Youth A and Youth C were ever placed on the
same pod. He stated that he was familiar with both youth and had
no concern over contact between the two.
Documentation reviewed:
• Email communication with the facility from 01/27/2025
confirmed that Youth A and Youth C were never placed in
the same pod together during their time placed in the
facility.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation reviewed There was no evidence
found that the safety of Youth A and Youth C was not ensured.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Title prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (1) A child caring institution, including private secure juvenile
Description justice facilities, shall establish a process improvement and
restraint reduction/elimination plan that:
(a) Includes documentation of each restraint.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation An incident involving the restraint of youth referenced in this
investigation did not have accompanying documentation.
Investigation Email communication occurred with the Licensee Designee and
other facility staff on 01/27/2025. It was confirmed that there were
no incident report documents pertaining to the incidents described
above with Youth B and Supervisor 1 400.4158 (1) (a) (ii). This
incident involved the use of physical intervention and physical
management in some form.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per interviews with
youth and staff. An incident that involved physical intervention
and physical management did not have necessary documentation
completed.
7

Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
